The Śūraṃgama Sūtra.
In one thought, sixty positions are established.
Like images in a pearl.
Although the types of things are many,
The pearl is entirely one.
One contains myriad images,
And myriad images return to enter the one pearl.
Like the sixty positions,
Each position contains sixty positions.
Moreover, each position is entirely the realization of the mind.
One mind can give rise to many minds,
And many minds return to enter the one mind.
Mind after mind mutually contains,
What obstacles are there?
